title: ChildStderr in std::process - Rust
markdown:
# ChildStderr in std::process - Rust

```
pub struct ChildStderr { /* private fields */ }
```

Expand description

A handle to a child processâ€™s stderr.

This struct is used in the [`stderr`](about:blank/struct.Child.html#structfield.stderr "field std::process::Child::stderr") field on [`Child`](struct.Child.html "struct std::process::Child").

When an instance of `ChildStderr` is [dropped](../ops/trait.Drop.html "trait std::ops::Drop"), the `ChildStderr`â€™s underlying file handle will be closed.

1.20.0 Â· [source](about:blank/src/std/process.rs.html#1535-1563)[Â§](#impl-From%3CChildStderr%3E-for-Stdio)

[source](about:blank/src/std/process.rs.html#1560-1562)[Â§](#method.from-4)

Converts a [`ChildStderr`](struct.ChildStderr.html "struct std::process::ChildStderr") into a [`Stdio`](struct.Stdio.html "struct std::process::Stdio").

##### [Â§](#examples)Examples

```
use std::process::{Command, Stdio};

let reverse = Command::new("rev")
    .arg("non_existing_file.txt")
    .stderr(Stdio::piped())
    .spawn()
    .expect("failed reverse command");

let cat = Command::new("cat")
    .arg("-")
    .stdin(reverse.stderr.unwrap()) // Converted into a Stdio here
    .output()
    .expect("failed echo command");

assert_eq!(
    String::from_utf8_lossy(&cat.stdout),
    "rev: cannot open non_existing_file.txt: No such file or directory\n"
);
```

[Run](https://play.rust-lang.org/?code=%23!%5Ballow(unused)%5D%0Afn+main()+%7B%0A++++use+std::process::%7BCommand,+Stdio%7D;%0A++++%0A++++let+reverse+=+Command::new(%22rev%22)%0A++++++++.arg(%22non_existing_file.txt%22)%0A++++++++.stderr(Stdio::piped())%0A++++++++.spawn()%0A++++++++.expect(%22failed+reverse+command%22);%0A++++%0A++++let+cat+=+Command::new(%22cat%22)%0A++++++++.arg(%22-%22)%0A++++++++.stdin(reverse.stderr.unwrap())+//+Converted+into+a+Stdio+here%0A++++++++.output()%0A++++++++.expect(%22failed+echo+command%22);%0A++++%0A++++assert_eq!(%0A++++++++String::from_utf8_lossy(%26cat.stdout),%0A++++++++%22rev:+cannot+open+non_existing_file.txt:+No+such+file+or+directory%5Cn%22%0A++++);%0A%7D&edition=2021)

1.74.0 Â· [source](about:blank/src/std/os/unix/process.rs.html#514-521)[Â§](#impl-From%3COwnedFd%3E-for-ChildStderr)

Available on **Unix** only.

Create a `ChildStderr` from the provided `OwnedFd`.

The provided file descriptor must point to a pipe with the `CLOEXEC` flag set.

[source](about:blank/src/std/os/unix/process.rs.html#516-520)[Â§](#method.from-2)

Converts to this type from the input type.

1.74.0 Â· [source](about:blank/src/std/os/windows/process.rs.html#143-149)[Â§](#impl-From%3COwnedHandle%3E-for-ChildStderr)

Available on **Windows** only.

Create a `ChildStderr` from the provided `OwnedHandle`.

The provided handle must be asynchronous, as reading and writing from and to it is implemented using asynchronous APIs.

[source](about:blank/src/std/os/windows/process.rs.html#144-148)[Â§](#method.from-1)

Converts to this type from the input type.
